title: @Meddler - Azir mini-rework?
body:
A while ago when discussing Azir you mentioned your general thoughts on him, and that a power-shift, likely from his Q to his W, would likely be/could be the next move, but probably wouldn't be ready for the next patch (either 6.24 or 7.1 i think?) and said it could be ready later (7.2/3?)

Just wondering if this is still the case/things are on track.

replies.body: Still planned at some point, we've got a few other mini-reworks that'll be first though. Guessing Rek'Sai will be the next, work's showing promise on her though is still a while off being finished. Focus of that update's on shifting her more towards diver and less tank (so more rewards for building AD, W likely shifting to single target knockup so less of her power's there etc).

Who would you say is still remaining on the "needs rework badly" list? Somebody in riot, I think maybe Ghostcrawler, let slip that Urgot is next after Galio, so who else does that leaves? Just off the top of my head I'm guessing Nunu, Aatrox, and possibly Swain.

Meddler is probably talking about full VGUs, which Aatrox is not a candidate for, as his visuals are perfectly fine and modern.
Aatrox will be a better candidate for a Gameplay Update as a part of the eventual Roster Update or something like the recent "Mini Reworks" (like the ones Anivia, Alistar and Shyvana recently got).

I think that Reav3 said that, after Warwick's Update's release, Galio (who is being worked on), Urgot and Evelynn will be the only ones left of what Riot/ChampUP tends to call the _*"Tier 1"* of champions that need an update-_ Those are ones that the years and patches did no good to them.

I'd personally say that Nunu, Mordekaiser, Mundo, Rammus, Swain, Malphite and Cho'Gath are ones that fit well into the _"Tier 2"_ list and good candidates for full VGUs after they're done with the _Tier 1_ champions.

Jax full rework?

Why not? Every single champ that's new has all sorts of mobility/multiple passives. A lot of older champs got tweaks/QoL buffs that made them feel much better. Jax feels awful to play in this season, and I think a buff to his AA range to at least 150 or 175 would ameliorate many of his issues the NUMBER ONE being cancelling auto attacks. I have played Jax for four years and he doesn't feel worse. His outdated kit just doesn't allow him to deal with the reworks/updated champs. He gets blown up so easily in teamfights and isn't even that strong of a duelist. As a Jax main I feel ignored and unwanted.
If you plan to change Reksai's knock-up, please ensure that it doesn't affect her jungling. That AOE knock-up is really handy to have against Raptors.

She'll need a tuning pass to ensure she still jungles appropriately after her ability effects have been updated yeah. Increased Q damage (higher AD ratio) will likely offset at least some of power lost off AOE knockup removal. Also possible we go with something like knockup on primary target, brief knockaside on others, damage on all.
That would be the intent yeah. Would imagine she'll still have Vanguard elements, but less Vanguard/more Diver than at present.

Could it be possible to tune the multi-target knock up towards being a "softer" form of CC?
Perhaps just knocking up targets directly underneath Rek'sai, whereas champions on the outermost range are merely applied a very large slow?
{{champion:266}} Hey, that's my job!
Would you ever be willing to tune her to also be viable as a top laner?

Will more of these mini-reworks or ability updates be detailed in the upcoming ChampUp blog post? I'm still eagerly awaiting Aatrox, and I know that Aurelion Sol, Kalista, and so on have been mentioned for this scope of work as well, and I'm sure many of those players are excited too. 

I don't want to mess with how the teams announce upcoming features, but I do still believe that semi-regular updates on progress are a very good thing for helping the community understand not only why something is happening, but also for potentially giving feedback earlier. Some of the past reworks (Shen for example) have not been as well received as something like Poppy or Sion, and simply opening the community up to feedback slightly earlier than PBE might mitigate some of this frustration in the future.

Anyway, thanks for all the work you guys/gals do at Riot, I know you work very hard and don't get praised for it enough. There are always things that people won't agree on, but at the end of the day you make the game that millions of people enjoy and you work hard to keep it that way, even when things have blowback or problems, and in my eyes that's a very noble thing.

These updates are being handled by the Live Gameplay team, given more of their focus than usual is on game health and balanceability (it's the sort of work either team could certainly do though). The upcoming Champ Up blog won't touch on them much or at all from memory.

Aurelion Sol, Kalista and Aatrox are all possible candidates someday for these sort of updates. Like Azir Kalista's likely to be one of the later ones, given the scope of work's large in part. If we do Aatrox as one of these it's also likely to be a smaller update, since we'd like to have Champ Up take a larger crack at him sometime too.

Is Ryze on your radar for a mini rework? He's got a sub-45% win rate in Plat+ despite being nearly pick or ban in LCS.

We don't think he needs an update, do think he needs some smaller mechanics changes though. We're currently testing having his W use a missile with a very fast travel time. Intent there is to reduce the extreme reliability it offers, allowing some brief re-positioning if you're really quick against it, while still letting it serve as a safety valve against really mobile champions. That's still a speculative change, so needs more investigation, shows some promise so far though.

I remember there being a brief mention about {{champion:28}} during the Assassin update about her getting some sort of rework in the future to push her away from being some weird diver, assassin, no-identity thing. Is she still a pretty big priority, or has she been pushed back?

Can you explain RIOT's choice for choosing RekSai? 

She seems like a consistent bungler and in a healthy spot.

I just want to comment on Rek'sai : the rework no one asked for.  Why, instead of bashing your own idea of a champ into our heads, don't you just accept that Rek'sai is a good tank?  You made a good tank.  No one that plays her think she needs a rework, they enjoy her kit and have adapted to the nerfs over her lifetime.  Speaking of nerfs, you nerfed her because she was a super powerful AD diver, and now you're talking about reworking her to be a super powerful AD diver.  Do you really, honestly, not see the problem there?  

You already tried to have her be an AD diver, it didn't work, now she's a great tank, contested pick but not OP, and you're going to go back to the drawing board to try that failed idea again?  

Leave her as is, and take all your cool ideas for a super powerful AD diver and apply them to a new champion (cough, Camile, cough)....wait, DON'T do that, and instead try making a balanced champion next.

The point of this is that years ago you accepted what your community did with your champions.  Things like Annie support, AP Ezreal mid, or other "off meta" or "off role" picks are great, you don't need to sit there and go "BUT WE WANTED ANNIE TO BE MID!"  or "BUT WE WANTED REK'SAI TO BE AN AD DIVER!".  

Instead, embrace how your community was able to adapt to your constant nerfs and meta balancing/updating and created a happy role for their favorite champion.
